XIV.8.2.a
.
Initial Stages of the Process for Handling Form FFP-3
The table below describes the initial stages for handling
Form FFP-3
.
Stage
Description
1
OIG routes to VBA batches of
Form FFP-3
that bear the names of individuals that are receiving benefits from VA or are dependents of VA beneficiaries.
2
For each fugitive felon case that meets the criteria for automated processing, a VBA computer application
establishes an EP 600
generates a notice of proposed adverse action, and
sends the notice to the affected beneficiary (and apportionee, if the individual named on
Form FFP-3
is an apportionee).
For each fugitive felon case that does
not
meet the criteria for automated processing, the computer application generates an EP 290 labeled
Fugitive Felon
.
Examples
:Â  Fugitive felon cases in which the following has occurred do
not
meet the criteria for automated processing:
arrest warrant was deemed invalid, or
individual named on
Form FFP-3
has already been arrested.
3
VBA uploads the
Form FFP-3
to the appropriate electronic claims folder (eFolder).
Notes
:
VBA does
not
usually upload
Form FFP-3
if the warrant for which the form was generated was cleared within 30 days of issuance.
Except as noted in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.2.c
, no further regional office (RO) action is required on fugitive felon cases that met the criteria for automated processing.
ROs must follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.2.b
for each fugitive felon case that did
not
meet the criteria for automated processing (as indicated by the generation of the EP 290 referenced in Stage 2).
